name: Sambal Belacan
author: Suhara
summary: This is a pungent chile condiment that is used as garnish over laksa dishes, dipping sauce for simple grilled fish or as a side condiment for any rice meals. It is considered a staple in a Malay household.
ingredients: 8  fresh red chile peppers, coarsely sliced
directions: Place belacan in a skillet over medium heat; cook and stir until fragrant and toasted, about 5 minutes
Grind red chile peppers with salt using a mortar and pestle until coarsely ground
Add belacan and grind until evenly distributed
Squeeze limes over paste just before serving
